noun.description: A shrub of tropical South America, Piper angustifolium (family Piperaceae), valued for its medicinal properties.
The fresh or dried leaves of the matico, used especially as a styptic.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in The Lancet. From Spanish Matico, further etymology uncertain; perhaps from the male forename Mateo, cognate with English Matthew + -ico, diminutive suffix, or perhaps from mato scrub, bush + -ico, diminutive suffix.
